file_content.text: Good. The mesa is sealed; no reinforcements will come, and no one can flee. I suggest you proceed to the estate.
Don't let your guard down. The Hutts' security may be broken, but Solida Hesk still has droids.
Manju the Hutt's forces are ahead. These are his elite slavers, responsible for turning the royal family of Vena into chattel for the Nar Shaddaa markets.
According to Manju, they also once brought him a Sith Lord in chains. I do not believe it.
Khobisho the Hutt's servants are near. They are Nikto whose clan has served the Hutts for twelve generations, bred for battle.
They are also known to keep formidable pets. Stay cautious.
You are approaching a cluster of Prodoranya the Hutt's bodyguards. These are enforcers from his manufacturing plants: brutes, not intelligent but physically powerful.
They can survive breathing toxins twenty hours a day. They will not die easily.
I am here. Securing the line.
I gather you felt that. If these quakes continue, none of us may escape intact.
Let the world tremble and tear itself apart. I am Sith, and I endure.
I don't fear groundquakes.
As I serve.
I wouldn't be concerned. I've caused stronger groundquakes than that.
I saw worse on Nar Shaddaa.
Yes, Dark Lord.
Knowing the ground's about to collapse keeps you focused, doesn't it?
At least we stay alert.
Heh. It does, at that.
My fee doesn't cover environmental damage. Make sure to tell that to Darth Marr.
I expect hazard pay for this.
Eight years, Ministry of Logistics. I know how to move around cash.
No games.
If that gravity hook topples, we're going to have a problem. Find a way to stabilize it.
Make sure to secure the base.
I'll put our science consultant on the job. He's en route to the planet now.
You're a tactical advisor, not my geologist. Advise me on tactics.
Just focus on the job.
As you wish.
Solida Hesk and her corporation hold the secrets of isotope-5. She is currently at her resort, hosting three Hutt clan lords.
Manju is a spice trafficker and slaver, Khobisho is a negotiator and advocate for the Cartel, and Prodoranya runs an industrial moon.
Hesk has installed substantial automated security, and each Hutt also has a cadre of bodyguards. Resistance is inevitable.
If an alarm goes out from the resort, the whole Hutt army will descend on us. Bodyguards will be the least of our problems.
We can't let the word spread.
I concur.
We're not talking about Nar Shaddaa thugs. Who exactly have the Hutts employed?
Tell me about the bodyguards.
Slavers and gladiators; beasts and beastmasters. Formidable opponents.
Handling "resistance" is the only reason I came to Makeb. I'm prepared.
That's why I'm here.
I do not doubt your abilities.
The resort is built on a self-contained mesa. Isolate the mesa, and neither reinforcements nor fleeing witnesses will pose a problem.
There are only a handful of landing pads around the resort, so I'd suggest destroying the pads and the shuttles.
However, the Hutts' bodyguards are garrisoned at the landing pads as well. To cut off the resort, you will need to pass through them.
The enemy will still be able to call for help, even if we cut off reinforcements.
What about communications?
We can't hide the attack altogether. We can only delay word from spreading and disguise our objective.
Killing may not be necessary. Do you have a holding facility ready?
I may want to take captives.
We're short-staffed to run a prison. But I'll see what I can do.
No way off the mesa, no one coming to help... the Hutts and their sponsor, trapped with me.
The enemy will not escape.
Shall we begin?
At your word.
I will monitor your position and update you as I can. May the Force grant you strength.
This is Lord Cytharat. There is a guard post near your landing position. I advise eliminating its protectors before they investigate.
Weapons ready!
My lord... they're not mercenaries.
My lord... that's not a mercenary.
Mighty Wrath--you came for us.
Dark Lord--you came for us.
Commander. I did not expect you to come.
You came for us. I did not expect it.
You and your team are resources. Throwing you away would be a waste.
You may still be useful.
You were between me and the exit. It was hard to avoid you.
Don't get all weepy.
I'm in charge of this mission. So long as I can help it, nobody dies.
I won't let people be killed.
Ah. Yes, of course.
He's bleeding pretty bad, but we can evacuate from here.
I'll have a medic ready at the gravity hook. If we have to ship those people to Kaas City for surgery, we will.
But I suggest you keep moving, before the droids catch up or reinforcements arrive.
That is not... what I was taught about leadership. Thank you.
Go. We will hold position here.
You were in danger. I was afraid I'd miss my opportunity to do this....
Of course I'm here. [Kiss him]
For that alone, I would have come to Makeb.
We have to get him out of here. He's worse off than he looks.
My only regret is that I cannot see the battle through at your side.
It's a pity. I was hoping we'd have time to get to know one another, but if we're doomed....
[Flirt] We can't have that.
Another reason to survive.
It is an honor.
